info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 4:15AM EST until February 04 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter of an inch. Sleet and snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Central and southeastern Catskills, mid-Hudson Valley, central and southern Taconics, southern Berkshires and northwestern Connecticut. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel will be difficult especially on untreated surfaces. This morning`s commute will be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain and sleet will continue through the morning. The precipitation will transition to snow as it tapers off during the mid to late afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
